column4: UPDATE 1-Mexico's Cemex posts quarterly loss due to coronavirus-led lockdowns
column5: (Adds CEO comment, background, details on results)
column6: July 27 (Reuters) - Mexican cement producer Cemex SAB de CV on Monday reported a loss for the second quarter, hurt by sales declines across most of its markets due to coronavirus-led lockdowns.
column7: The United States, Cemex’s biggest market, was the only region to report positive sales growth of 1%.
column8: Its other markets including Mexico, Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia, and South, Central America and the Caribbean posted declines of between 10% and 30%.
column9: Net loss was $44 million in the second quarter, compared with a profit of $155 million a year earlier.
column10: “In the quarter, we saw a rapid V-shaped volume recovery in our core products from trough levels in April, reaching slightly below pre-COVID-19 volumes in June,” Chief Executive Officer Fernando González said.
column11: “We expect that COVID-19 will continue to challenge our operations in new ways over the next few quarters.”
column12: Monterrey-based Cemex, which operates in more than 50 countries, said earlier this year it was delaying capital expenditure and cutting a percentage of employees’ salaries or allowances for a period of three months to cut costs amid the coronavirus crisis. (Reporting by Ankit Ajmera in Bengaluru; Editing by Aditya Soni)
